entry.et: Middle English trippen, from Anglo-French treper, triper, of Germanic origin; akin to Old English treppan to tread trap

def.dt: :to dance, skip, or caper with light quick steps
:to walk with light quick steps
:to catch the foot against something so as to stumble
:to make a mistake or false step (as in morality or accuracy)
:to stumble in articulation when speaking
:to make a journey
:to actuate a mechanism
:to become operative
:to get high on a psychedelic drug (as LSD) :turn on often used with out
:freak 3b
:to cause to stumble often used with up
:to cause to fail :obstruct often used with up
:to detect in a misstep, fault, or blunder
:expose usually used with up
:to perform (as a dance) lightly or nimbly
:to raise (an anchor) from the bottom so as to hang free
:to pull (a yard) into a perpendicular position for lowering
:to hoist (a topmast) far enough to enable the fid to be withdrawn preparatory to housing or lowering
:to release or operate (a mechanism) especially by releasing a catch or detent trip the fire alarm
:dance
:a stroke or catch by which a wrestler is made to lose footing
:voyage journey
:a single round or tour on a business errand
:error misstep
:a quick light step
:a faltering step caused by stumbling
:the action of tripping mechanically
:a device for tripping a mechanism (as a catch or detent)
:an intense visionary experience undergone by a person who has taken a psychedelic drug (as LSD)
:an exciting or unusual experience the party was a trip
:absorption in or obsession with an interest, attitude, or state of mind a guilt trip on a nostalgia trip
:scene lifestyle
:one that takes a trip :tourist
:a tripping device (as for operating a railroad signal)
:a massive power hammer having a head that is tripped and allowed to fall by cam or lever action
:suggesting a trip-hammer in loud pounding or persistent action

entry.et: probably blend of trip (high from a psychedelic drug) + hip-hop

def.dt: :electronic dance music usually based on a slow hip-hop beat and incorporating hypnotic synthesized and prerecorded sounds
:a low-placed concealed wire used especially in warfare to trip an enemy or trespasser and usually to trigger an alarm or explosive device when moved
:something (as a small military force) intended to function like a trip wire (as to set a larger military force in motion)
:an act or course of action that enhances and satisfies one's ego
:a visit (as to a factory, farm, or museum) made (as by students and a teacher) for purposes of firsthand observation
:to cause feelings of guilt in guilt-tripped them into helping
